content: Does MSG cause migraine headaches and contribute to obesity?

No, MSG does not cause migraine headaches or contribute to obesity. In fact, MSG is a naturally occurring substance found in many foods, including cheese, tomatoes, and mushrooms. It is also added to some foods as a flavor enhancer. Numerous scientific studies have shown that MSG is safe for consumption and does not cause any adverse health effects when consumed in moderation. So, you can enjoy foods containing MSG without worrying about any negative impact on your health.
